COMMUNICATIONS FOR THE REINFORCEMENT OF
EDUCATION
COMMUNICATIONS FOR THE REINFORCEMENT OF
JOB SKILL TRAINING
We describe these in the following way:
COMMUNICATIONS FOR SURVIVAL: The development of com¬
munications (telephone and/or short wave radio CER)
systems to overcome the isolation of people living
in rural areas of poverty.
COMMUNICATIONS FOR INTERFACING THE COMMUNITY ACTION
AGENCY, THE TARGET POPULATION, AND EXISTING COMMUNITY
RESOURCE STRUCTURES: The development of clear paths
of access to electronic communications (radio and
television) to assist in the task of achieving two-way
dialogues aimed at the improvement of community action
instruments (programs), and achieving the widest par¬
ticipation of the target population. This is applicable,
equally, in those instances where great distances sepa¬
rate the Community Action Agency from the target popu¬
lation, as well as in those instances where the mobility
of the target population, in an "inner city", is a
considerable factor.
